column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=Polycrystalline samples of Ca4LnO(BO3)3 (Ln = La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Eu,
#Text=Gd, Tb, Dy, Ho, Y, Er, Yb) were synthesized according to a ceramic
#Text=procedure, adapted from ref 20, from CaCO3 (99.99%), H3BO3
#Text=(99.999%) and Ln2O3 (Ln = La, Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd, Dy, Ho, Y, Er, Yb),
#Text=Pr6O11, or Tb4O7 (all lanthanide oxides ≥99.99%).
#Text=Lanthanide oxides
#Text=were predried at 800 °C overnight prior to weighing out.
#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of the reagents (except in the case of Ln =
#Text=Yb: see below) were ground with a pestle and mortar and placed in an
#Text=alumina crucible.
#Text=The powder was first heated in air at 900 °C for 4 h
#Text=in order to effect decomposition of the boric acid and calcium
#Text=carbonate.
#Text=The sample was subsequently cooled, reground, and
#Text=reheated to 1200 °C for several days, with intermediate regrinding
#Text=every 24 h, until the percentages of impurity phases no longer
#Text=changed.
